heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.7°C) and outside temperature (up 3.5°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 592 m) and pressure (up 12 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 997 m) and light levels (up 5826 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 592.1m lower than yesterday, 888.8m lower than the past week, 996.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 760m minimum and 2130m maximum, with an average of 739.4m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1628.2m and 1736.0m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and winds will be practically absent. Showers, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and a mix of sun and clouds. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
